title: What are some undecidable problems for computers? - Quora

response.answer_text: A decision problem for which it is impossible to construct an algorithm is undecidable problem. Halting problem is undecidable, the problem statement says that, if your given a program description and an input can you determine whether the program will ever halt or continue running forever. Alan Turing proved that a general algorithm for halting problem cannot exist.

All of undecidability are homeomorphic in sub part to Gödel’s Incompleteness Theorems and use Cantor's diagonal argument - Wikipedia in one way or other. Which basically transforms it into Halting problem - Wikipedia. Here is some list. List of undecidable problems - Wikipedia
